description.narrative: Cosan S. A. Indústria e Comércio (Cosan, the company or Group) is the parent company of the largest integrated sugar and ethanol producer and exporter in Brazil, and one of the largest and most efficient producers in the world. Cosan reached this position by acquiring and turning around sugar mills, mostly during the last four years. Cosan operates 12 mills, 3 sugar refineries and one export terminal at the Port of Santos. All facilities are located in the State of São Paulo, in Brazils Center-South region, with the exception of one small sugar refinery located in the State of Santa Catarina, South region. In FY 2004, ended April 30, Cosan milled 26.1 million mt of cane, sold 2.2 million mt of sugar (of which 82% or 1.8 million mt were exported), and 946 million liters of ethanol (of which 23% or 214 million liters were exported). The proposed project, to be implemented over the FY05 to FY07 period (May 2004 to April 2006), will allow the company: - to maintain its leading position in the Brazilian sugar industry; - to respond to growing demand for fuel ethanol, particularly in the domestic market; and - to respond to increased competition in international markets by improving agricultural yields and cutting costs. More specifically, the project will allow Cosan to increase its installed milling capacity, improve sugar cane agricultural yields and further reduce costs. The project will also support Cosans efforts to improve monitoring and compliance of environmental and social standards.

name.narrative: Cosans operations are located in the State of São Paulo, Center-South of Brazil, where all mills and agricultural operations are based, with the exception of a small sugar refinery located in the South. Brazils Center-South region has some of the best cane growing land in the world in terms of soil, topography and climate. As a result, this region has some of the lowest production costs in the world. This natural competitive advantage is compounded by the very large size of cane farms, efficient farming practices, long harvest season and large and efficient mills. Cosans headquarters are located in the city of São Paulo, capital of the State, and the management of industrial and agricultural operations is based in the city of Piracicaba, in the interior of the State.
